humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'pT2pN1a(1/14)L1', which indicates that the tumor is T2 (maximum tumor diameter between 2.1 to 5.0 cm) and N1 (metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). The '(1/14)' indicates that 1 out of 14 assessed lymph nodes were positive for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'lymph node metastasis extending beyond the capsule into the surrounding soft tissue' which indicates that the cancer has spread to at least one axillary lymph node and has gone beyond the capsule. This is consistent with a pathologic N1 stage. The '(1/14)' indicates that out of 14 lymph nodes examined, one had cancer. This is also consistent with N1 staging.
